review: Love it. Great interface that is very easy to use.Pros: Voice recognition is brilliant. We can look up shows in a fraction of the time it used to take typing it in. There is no going back from here - the microphone has reclaimed its role and now become the input device of the year.Cons: Memory is only 8GB and at least for gaming, that is not very much. I wish that they had had the foresight to put an SD slot in this.
author: Amazon Customer "KindleParent"

review: The difference between this and the Roku 3 in its basic operation is not discernible. There are some differences that you will want to consider however, before making a purchase. While Fire TV has a voice activated search function, it does not have a couple of functions that the Roku 3 has, and these are two functions that I find highly desirable. For one, the sound output on the remote with its own volume control is not just something I like, its something my wife loves. There is no sound coming from the TV that would disturb her and what she is doing, and I can hear comfortably through the earphones. The other is the non-directional remote hand unit that avoids the need to stretch your wrist into a position many find uncomfortable. I bought one Fire TV, but I'm waiting for the second generation for improvements.
